text: Heidelberg University is a public research university in Heidelberg, Baden- WÃ¼rttemberg, Germany. It was founded in 1386 on the instructions of Pope Urban VI. Heidelberg is Germany's oldest university, and is one of the world's oldest surviving universities. It was the third university established in the Holy Roman Empire. Prague (1348) and Vienna (1365) were at that time also German-speaking universities. The University of Vienna still is. Irrespective of the shared language of instruction, Heidelberg is the oldest university in modern Germany. At the beginning, there were only the four traditional faculties. In 1890, the natural science got their own faculty. Later after a re-organisation, the university has 12 faculties. The University of Heidelberg is also known as Ruprecht Karl University of Heidelberg, after the German prince Rupert I. == References == Category:1380s establishments Heidelberg Category:Heidelberg
